review.description: Great tea selection, great pastries (namely the goat cheese & artichoke croissant), great bread. But also pretty overpriced.
review.author: Paige W.

review.description: yesyesyes amen to the pain de chocolat.  waaay to close to my apartment to be a good thing for my overall physique.  thank god i'm asian.
review.author: Joan C.

review.description: Sure it's expensive. But for the best pastries and breads I've had outside Paris or Tartine in San Francisco, it's worth every penny.
review.author: Julie E.

review.description: The place is ok. Crazy owner. But all the pastries are too sweet and the sandwiches suck. Very chain like.  Its Brooklyn. The village has the best bakeries.
review.author: mary l.

review.description: I bought an assortment of pastries and a baguette this morning.  They were all incredibly delicious.  The pastries were so light and not too sweet.  The baguette was absolutely awesome...crunchy and airy in the inside.  They are expensive, but the quality is so far superior that it's worth it.  Much better than balthazar...even better than Daniel Boulud!
review.author: K. L.

review.description: all products looked burned, did not buy, not even a croissant and soooo expensive
review.author: Cordula H.
